intro: Thesium arvense, commonly known as field thesium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae. It is a small, herbaceous perennial that typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually greenish or yellowish in color. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Thesium arvense is adapted to thrive in temperate climates and is often found in grasslands and along roadsides.
